sentences.sentence: China's President Xi Jinping has secured a historic third term as the Communist Party's leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Residents urge to leave the Ukrainian city of Kherson and power outages across the country after Russian missiles target energy plants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands attend a rally in Berlin in support of women-led protests in Iran over the death in custody of Massa Amini.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After a three-year break due to the pandemic, the ghouls and ghosts return to the streets of Mexico City for the annual zombie walk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: China's President Xi Jinping is now all but certain to sail through to a third term as the country's leader,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: re-elected head of the Communist Party and cementing his place as the nation's most influential ruler since Mao Zedong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On behalf of the CPC new central leadership, Xi says, I wish to thank the whole party sincerely for the trust you have placed in us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We will keep in mind the party's nature, our own mission and responsibility and work diligently in the performance of our duties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Appointing Xi as its General Secretary for a precedent-breaking five-year term tilts the country decisively back towards one-man rule. Appointing Xi as its General Secretary for a precedent-breaking five-year term tilts the country decisively back towards one-man rule, after decades of power-sharing among its elites.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The CCP also named a seven-member Politburo Standing Committee led by Xi, an inner circle of power dominated by the party's allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He will be formally announced president during the government's annual legislative sessions in March.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russian officials said on Saturday that two people were killed and 12 wounded by Ukrainian shelling in the town of Shebukino in the Belgorod region close to the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The regional health minister said one of the dead was a 14-year-old boy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The town has now started building protective structures, according to the local governor, who posted images on social media.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in the south, pro-Russian authorities in Kherson are continuing to urge residents to leave in the face of Kyiv's advancing counteroffensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Observers expect fierce clashes to take place in and around the city as both sides battle for control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On the Ukrainian side, the air force said critical infrastructure across the country was pounded by Russian missiles on Saturday, with several regions reporting strikes on energy facilities and power outages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Volodymyr Zelensky said the attacks were on a very wide scale. In his nightly address, he called on citizens to cut down their use of electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The main target for the Russian terrorists is energy, therefore please consume electricity even more consciously than before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The stability of our state energy industry depends on each city and district of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The General Staff of the Ukraine Armed Forces said Russian forces have been pushed out of more settlements in the Kherson region. Ukrainian forces are targeting resupply routes across a major river, while inching closer to a full-scale assault on the key city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some 80,000 people joined a Berlin rally on Saturday in solidarity with women-led protests in Iran sparked by the death in custody of Masa Amini. Some marches at a rally organized by a women's collective brandished slogans such as women, life, freedom. Some waving Kurdish flags, a reference to Amini's origins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our correspondent said thousands of people, maybe tens of thousands, have come from all over the world to Berlin to take part in demonstrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He met people who came from as far away as Sweden and Canada to support the people in Iran and be their voice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I came from Stuttgart, Germany, said one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It took us hours to get here just to tell our sisters and brothers, all of those on the streets of Iran, you're not alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are here, but our hearts are with you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This woman said, I come from Milan and I brought the message of support from all the Iranians who could not make it here today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Iran has seen some six weeks of growing women-led protests in anger over the death in police custody of Amini, a 22-year-old arrested for allegedly breaching the country's strict dress code for women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The protests are the biggest scene in the Islamic Republic for years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Giorgia Maloney has been sworn in as Italy's first female prime minister and the country's first far-right leader to head the nation's government since the Second World War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Her coalition allies include the right-wing League of Matteo Salvini and the conservative Forza Italia party, headed by former premier Silvio Berlusconi. 45-year-old Maloney took the oath of office before the Italian president Sergio Mattarella at the presidential palace on Saturday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The new leader had announced her cabinet on Friday ahead of the swearing-in ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Her deputy and minister for foreign affairs is Antonio Tahini, a former journalist and soldier who served as President of the European Parliament between 2017 and 2019.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Although Maloney's Brothers of Italy party won the election taking 26% of the vote, she still needed the support of Matteo Salvini's anti-migrant League party and former Premier Silvio Berlusconi's Forza Italia to form a coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Their parties polled 8% of the vote each in the election that saw a record low turnout.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And although they'll all be working together, there have already been tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Berlusconi and Salvini are longtime admirers of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Maloney staunchly backs Ukraine in its defense against the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He's coming back from his holiday in the Caribbean, but could Boris Johnson also make a comeback to Downing Street as Prime Minister?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He was forced out of the job three months ago, but is now reported to be considering a bid to replace Liz Truss as leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: His supporters say he'll reach the required 100 MPs to make the move.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The current leader of the House of Commons, Penny Mordaunt, was the first candidate to publicly declare that she's running for office. On Friday, she took to social media, promising she could deliver a fresh start for the Conservative Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And on Sunday, Boris Johnson's former finance minister, Rishi Sunak, also declared his intention to run, having lost out to trust last time round.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: UK media reports claim he's received enough nominations from Tory MPs to pass the threshold.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Candidates must secure the support of at least 100 Conservative MPs by Monday afternoon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: If two or more contenders emerge, party members get to cast their ballot online next Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.sentence: Doused in fake blood, wearing torn clothing and masks, the participants enjoyed the grisly parade after a three-year hiatus due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In front of an applauding crowd of thousands, world-renowned American film director Tim Burton was recognized for his 35-year-long career in the birthplace of cinema.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The director was overwhelmed by emotion when receiving the Lumiere Award in Lyon, France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For me, this is like, honestly, like I said, I've never felt so much anything in one place before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He's best known for his fascination with gothic fantasy and horror and is the man behind cult classics such as Edward Scissorhands and Nightmare Before Christmas.
